title: Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP)
description: Emergency rental assistance through this program is only available if the tenant is still living at the property.

title: Temporary Rental & Utility Assistance (TRUA)
description: Offers grants to Denver residents in housing crises, helping to prevent eviction, stabilize housing, and provide assistance with utility payments.

title: Denver Housing Authority
description: A quasi-municipal corporation managing over 13,000 units and vouchers, offering affordable housing to 26,000 individuals, including low and middle-income families.

title: Denver Human Services
description: Emergency assistance is available to qualifying Denver County residents only for rent assistance, eviction assistance, 1st month's rent, deposit assistance and utility assistance.

title: Village Resource Center
description: Determined to help with the mounting pressure caused by rising rents, VRC formed to pool their resources, to provide for the people in the community who are facing hardship. Together, they formed a 501(c)3 nonprofit, working in Denver, Arapahoe, and Douglas counties, helping individuals and families who are temporarily struggling to afford housing costs.
